title: For Plant Lovers, an Ideal Abode in London
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Westbourne Green, London

Price: £9.95 million (US$12.13 million)

This converted house in London is arranged around a lush courtyard garden. The property’s five bedrooms look out or open onto an indoor, plant-filled garden, with a glazed roof and front entrance, which gives it the feeling of a Moroccan riad, according to listing agency The Modern House.

St. Stephen’s Yard, as the property’s been named, occupies its own private mews, formed of a cobbled no-through lane enclosed by an L-shaped former stable building and a party wall. The passageway and buildings have been incorporated into a single residence by NG Architecture.

The little-altered building’s façades, original cobbles on the ground, a climber-clad brick wall, potted tropical plants and benches offer a picturesque mews scene at either end of the indoor garden.

More: Successful Welsh Wine Estate Asks £15 Million

Light floods in through the courtyard garden roof and via sky and roof lights in the property’s ground- and-first floor ceilings. It flows around the living spaces, which are open plan, neutrally decorated and feature a curved floating staircase with open treads.

The "scale, light and ethereality" of the property and its "sense of tranquillity and privacy cannot be overstated," said listing agent Corey Hemingway.

Stats

The 5,000-square-foot house has four bedrooms, three bathrooms (two en-suite), a conservatory and an open-plan kitchen/reception room on the ground floor.

Amenities

There is off-street parking with space for three cars, which is generous for a central London location, according to Mr. Hemingway.

The first floor includes a master bedroom with an en suite bathroom, sauna and a dressing room, a study, media room and two rooftop terraces, which provide outdoor space.

The lower ground floor contains a wine cellar, store and boiler room.

Neighborhood Notes

The property is off Chepstow Road, a road just south of Westbourne Park Road set between Westbourne Park and Royal Oak Tube stations.

There is quick access to green spaces from the house as it’s located close to Hyde Park, which is a 15-minute walk away.

Listing agent: Corey Hemingway, The Modern House
